title: Designing Effective Organizational Communication Strategies Through Concept Mapping of Business Communication

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced expertise and extensive practical experience in the field (business/society), with foundational understanding of organizational structures, economic principles, and political dynamics
context.additional_context: An environment for pre-service and in-service teachers enabling integration with digital collaboration tools via personal devices (BYOD). Explores lesson design and assessment methods considering interdisciplinary connections with social studies.

learning_goals: Learners visualize core concepts of business communication (e.g., organizational communication, conflict management, negotiation strategies) using concept-mapping tools for systematic organization. This process enhances understanding of relationship-building and decision-making in social organizations.

Learners analyze interactions between concepts to design communication strategies applicable to real-world business scenarios, particularly strengthening negotiation skills among stakeholders in political and economic contexts.
Learners iteratively improve their concept maps through peer feedback and formative assessments, cultivating collaborative abilities and cultural sensitivity as responsible citizens.

resources: Digital Concept Mapping Tools (e.g., Miro, Coggle)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
